# Who is Balendra Shah, frontrunner for Nepal PM post after KP Sharma Oli’s sudden resignation

## Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned in the face of massive anti-government protests rocking the country. Oli stepped down shortly after hundreds of demonstrators entered his office shouting anti-government slogans.

Updated: September 9, 2025 2:50 PM IST

By [Analiza Pathak](https://www.india.com/author/analiza-pathak/) \| Edited by [Analiza Pathak](https://www.india.com/author/analiza-pathak/)

- [Follow Us](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMOXc-AowjvHeAg?hl=en-IN&gl=IN&ceid=IN:en)

# Who is Balendra Shah? After KP Sharma Oli resigns as PM amid unrest in Nepal, Kathmandu Mayor seen as frontrunner

## With KP Sharma Oli's resignation and President Ramchanra Paudel's reported search for a replacement, the focus has now shifted to Kathmandu mayor Balendra Shah, who is being considered one of the frontrunners of the Prime Minister's post.

[**Swastika Das Sharma**](https://www.livemint.com/authors/swastika-das-sharma)

Updated9 Sep 2025, 05:00 PM IST

Balendra Shah, Mayor of Kathmandu **(Facebook)**

Nepal Gen Z Protests: Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli has resigned from his post amid a landmark protest led by the country's youth against the government's alleged corruption and police brutality following the country's ban on 26 social media apps.

search_results.title: Sushila Karki, Balendra Shah or someone else? Names emerge as Nepal looks for next leader
Who’s leading Nepal after Oli resignation, what’s next for Gen Z protests?
search_results.text:
Nepali army soldiers patrol at the road near the Singha Durbar office complex that houses the PM's office and other ministries on Wednesday \[Navesh Chitrakar/Reuters\]

By [Sarah Shamim](https://www.aljazeera.com/author/sarah-shamim)

Published On 10 Sep 202510 Sep 2025

Click here to share on social media

Share

Save

Nepal’s military has taken over the streets of the capital, Kathmandu, in a bid to end two days of protests against corruption that rapidly escalated into a full-blown public revolt against the country’s political elite, culminating in Prime Minister KP Oli’s [resignation](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/9/9/nepali-pm-forced-to-step-down-parliament-torched-amid-deadly-protests) on Tuesday.

At least 19 people were killed in clashes with security forces on Monday that further inflamed protesters, who on Tuesday set the country’s [Parliament building](https://www.aljazeera.com/gallery/2025/9/9/protesters-torch-nepal-parliament-as-pm-resigns-amid-turmoil) on fire whil

search_results.title: Among Nepal's Top PM Contenders, Who's the Biggest ...
search_results.text:
ADVERTISEMENT [REMOVE AD](https://www.thequint.com/plan-selection?utm_source=remove_ad&utm_medium=remove_ad_button)

# Among Nepal's Top PM Contenders, Who's the Biggest 'Red Flag' for India?

## Balendra Shah, Sushila Karki, and Ram Chandra Poudel are the frontrunners to lead an embattled Nepal.

[Eshwar](https://www.thequint.com/author/431875/eshwar-gole-2)

Published: 11 Sep 2025, 4:20 PM IST

[World](https://www.thequint.com/news/world)

i

Aa

Aa

Small

Aa

Medium

Aa

Large

A 34-year-old rapper-turned-politician, Nepal’s first female Chief Justice, the current President, and a former journalist-turned-politician have emerged as the leading contenders to head the country’s transitional government.

Organisers of the Gen Z protests that have gripped Nepal in recent weeks have put forward Kathmandu Mayor Balendra ‘Balen’ Shah, former Chief Justice Sushila Karki, President Ram Chandra Poudel, and former deputy PM Rabi Lamicchane as the top candidates to steer the embattled nation.

metadata.title: Who will be the next non-caretaker prime minister of Nepal? (Balendra Shah)
metadata.description:
The Federal: [Who could be Nepal's next prime minister? Here are 5 top contenders](https://thefederal.com/category/international/nepals-next-prime-minister-after-olis-controversial-exit-206263)

> Scuffles were reported among Gen-Z factions backing different contenders outside the Nepal Army headquarters in Kathmandu on Wednesday evening, as talks to pick an interim leader after the violent overthrow of the government extended into the third day.

> KP Sharma Oli resigned as prime minister on Tuesday, leaving the post vacant while the anti-corruption revolt continues without a clear leader.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":39851,"question_id":39395}}`
metadata.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Balendra Shah'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

This question resolves as **Yes** for the individual who, after September 11, 2025 and before January 1, 2026 takes the [oath](https://www.constituteproject.org/constitution/Nepal_2016#s852) of office and secrecy as the new [Prime Minister of Nepal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Nepal) and wins a vote of confidence in the House of Representatives as required by [section 76](https://www.constituteproject.org/constitution/Nepal_2016#s795) of the Constitution of Nepal. The question resolves as **No** for everyone else. If none of the listed candidates fulfills the criteria during that time period, then the question resolves as **No** for every option.
metadata.fine_print: This is a Group question, so you do not have to assess probabilities for every option. More options may be added after the question opens, if there is [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) reporting that a particular individual has a material probability of coming the next PM of Nepal.
